title: Historic Opioid Settlement and New Name for NFL Team
itunes:title: Historic Opioid Settlement and New Name for NFL Team
description:
Healthcare law expert Harry Nelson of Nelson Hardiman discusses the historic $590 million dollar settlement Native American tribes have reached over the toll of opioids with drugmaker Johnson & Johnson and the country's three largest drug distribution companies.

Susan Decker, Bloomberg Patents Reporter, discusses the way sports franchises like the Washington Commanders, resort to extreme measures to keep interlopers at bay ahead of a name change. 

June Grasso hosts.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
